awd_titl_txt: Spectroscopy Characterization of Metastable Intermediates   in Relation to Surface Elementary Reactions
awd_abstract_narration: This project is in the area of Analytical and Surface Chemistry                 and in the subfield of surface science.  Professor Zaera will                   study metastable adsorbates chemiabsorbed on single crystal                     surfaces using a host of spectroscopic methods.                                                                                                                 This research will focus on detecting highly hydrogenated                       carbonaceous fragments on clean metal surfaces using                            reflection-absorption infrared spectroscopy during catalytic                    reactions.  The results from this project will be useful in                     understanding catalytic hydrocarbon conversion reactions and in                 designing new catalytic processes.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
